Posts.Content: syzygy1979 wrote: I am 30 years old and last year I had what I thought was a large fibroadenoma removed from my left breast.  It turned out to be a phyllodes tumor which is a type of breast cancer.  Three days ago, I was told that I have another 2 tumors of this type because of rapid growth.  My doctor said that these tumors should be removed immediately.  However, he stated that because of the size of them and having both removed it will completely deform my breast and suggested a breast implant.  He also mentioned possibly having a partial mastectomy.  I am scared out of my wits!!!  I don't know what to do.  My mom, who was just diagnosed with breast cancer in October suggested that I get a second opinion from another doctor.  I don't know who specializes in these types of tumors because its a rare kind of tumor.  Does anyone know of a good hospital in the northeast?  What should I ask the second opinion doctor?  Should I get the mastectomy?  Should I get an implant?  Please Help!!!!!
